author: Alain L
title: Arguably some of the most friendly, helpful and attentive staff of any hotel, with an outstanding location..
text:
The Barocco is a quaint little hotel at the Piazza Barberini. This places it only a brief walk from two of Rome's loved attractions, the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. It is also generally very conveniently located. We went there with our daughter and had booked two "classic" rooms. These are small and a little claustrophobic for a couple, although fine for single occupancy. We followed the staff's advice and upgraded, for a modest amount, to a junior suite (ours was room 49), with plenty of space and a large balcony overlooking Barberini square. The breakfast, included in the price, was very good, and there are many good restaurants nearby (avoid the "tourist traps", however, and let the staff guide you. The Barocco is a charming place.
Room Tip: Junior suite 49 boasts plenty of space with a large balcony overlooking Barberini square. See more room tips
